job_title: Sr. Manager Business Development in Austin, TX
pros: I'm writing this review because while considering working for Cenikor the reviews on Glassdoor almost turned me away. I'm very glad I listened to my gut and accepted the position. So far this has been one of the most organized, professional, and mission driven organizations I have worked for. Please don't let the reviews scare you away. -Thorough training -HR department that seems to really be invested in your success. -Departments appear to be well organized. -Room for advancement. -CEO is engaged with employees across all locations - Due to good stewardship this company appears to be safe to weather any potential economical storm.
cons: I have not experienced any cons so far.

pros: SUPPORT/ENCOURAGING ATONNOMY FLEXABILITY COMMUNITY INVOLVEMENT PEOPLE WHO REALLY CARE ABOUT WHAT THEY ARE DOING. NOT JUST HERE FOR A JOB. Cenikor Foundation is a great place to live out your passion. If you are passionate about the health and well-being of your fellow man. The family that is cultivated at Cenikor Amarillo is one that has and will fight for client and employee betterment. I have worked at a lot of great places but Cenikor Amarillo is by far the one that has allowed me to truly grow my potential and live my passion. The facility director, Debra King, has told me from day one that she is looking for people with passion for their fellowman. If you are just looking for a job, please, please pass us by. But if you have a passion to help those who are broken come to Cenikor Foundation and live your passion.
cons: NOT ENOUGH PEOPLE TO SHARE THE VISION THERE ARE TIMES WHEN THERE IS REQUIRED OVERTIME

job_title: Behavioral Health Technician in Houston, TX
pros: Overtime opportunities, fulfilling work, freedom to work with your own style
cons: At odyssey house the staff was unfriendly and did not train me. They expected me to know everything when I had no experience in the field. The program director enabled my supervisor to be disgusting towards me from day 1 - she ignored me when I tried to introduce myself and lied about it. He expected us to live for the company and stay late without warning. He also lied to my face about what was going on to get me to stay late. Fortunately a badass lady came in from corporate and cleaned the place up right before I had to leave (moved away).

review_title: Stay away unless you like toxicity.
pros: A few good staff actually cared.
cons: This used to be a good company, but someone has to look at why every good leader has left. Corporate environment is fake and the CEO is condoned for his immature behavior, rude, discriminatory comments and narcissistic behaviors. Senior leadership are entirely disconnected or are too new to know better. The work environment is abusive and toxic. I wouldn't recommend this place for anyone. Read the reviews, they aren't wrong. You are either ignored or attacked when you bring concerns forward.

pros: Working with the clients is the best part of the job. PTO is generous.
cons: Corporate leadership doesn't care about their people. Too much corporate overhead so the facility has to work harder and harder at low wages to fulfill the higher salaries of people in the golden tower. Computers are always crashing, and you might get a refurbished one after a 6 week wait. They want you to keep up with a ridiculous pace to keep every bed full. No sense in taking time off because you get blamed for things that are not done while you are out taking care of your family. Facility leaderahip is absent a lot and when they are there they want to tell you how bad you are doing and how we won't make budget because there are empty beds. I feel threatened every day that we are going to get fired

review_title: Cenikor - Excellent Career Path w/ Leadership Development & Education Reimbursement - 401K Second to None
job_title: Director of Business Development in Waco, TX
pros:
If you are truly looking for a career where you can grow as an individual and develop as a business leader, then Cenikor is for you. Cenikor offers a leadership development program to enroll in after 1 year of employment if you so choose. This LEAD program provides you with grow & development for you as an individual and you as a business leader. The LEAD program has 3 different tiers for you to progress through with tuition reimbursement provided by Cenikor if you so choose to want to further your education with Bachelors degree, Masters degree, Clinical Licenses, Etc. This is outstanding for all that are looking to progress in life & in business.

Cenikor looks to build leaders from within, giving many people who are truly looking for a career opportunity to make their way to whatever level of excellence that they are looking to achieve in their business career. Cenikor is in major grow mode. This is a 55 year old company that in their 1st 45 years in business had 80 total employees and in the last ten years has grown to close to 600 employees. Cenikor has had recent acquisitions that have expanded their landscape to additional states outside of Texas.

If you truly thinking about building a long term career and you want to feel secure with a future, Cenikor separates themselves with their 401 K plan. After year 1, Cenikor will contribute 5% of your total compensation to your 401k. 
5% is yours regardless. If you decided to participate further and contribute another 5% which would be deducted from your pay check tax free, then Cenikor will contribute an additional 5%, for a TOTAL OF 15%. If you do your homework, you will find that this plan is second to none. 

At Cenikor you have an opportunity to save lives and change the dynamic of many families for a life time. It is truly rewarding and it is hard work that you can be truly proud of when you walk out the door at the end of each day.
cons: This is a very fast pace environment, which for me I love. It is trying at times here at Cenikor because we are dealing with addicts' who do not see much hope for themselves. You will have to adjust to just understand, that you can only do your best each and every day. Not everyone will want the help when it is offered to them and that will be frustrating at times. Cenikor will always keep the door open for the clients for when they are ready.

There are so many awesome non-profits in the Houston area, please invest your skills and effort in a foundation that will also invest in you.

review_title: Great place to build a future for motivated people!
job_title: Director of Facilities in Fort Worth, TX
pros: Cenikor is a great place to build a career for those motivated and dedicated to helping change lives. The benefits offered are the best in the business. A newly implemented pay scale increase makes the compensation comparable to the "for profit" treatment facilities in the area.   The organization has really moved in a positive direction over the past two years and shows a commitment to developing and keeping top performing staff. The leadership development program provided to staff is second to none. For those willing to put in the effort, opportunities at advancement are endless.
cons: Don't really consider these to be cons...but if you had rather complain by yourself, than look for solutions as a team...this is not the place for you. If you are lazy and dramatic...you won't like it here. If you are unethical...you won't make it long. Bottom line...if you are an unmotivated, complainer, with no moral compass...this will be "the worst place you have ever worked". The rest of us love it here and couldn't imagine doing anything else.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in San Marcos, TX
pros: Upon hire, certain employees within certain roles and teams are told the position is mobile and the schedule is flexible. There is some ability to work from home or sites where services are provided, but be prepared to be questioned and micromanaged regularly. Exact expectations from leadership are not clear-cut or explained in detail, even when the questions are asked.
cons: The pay is poor. The actual job duties and expectations (type of work, services provided, amount of travel , etc.) are not presented clearly and honestly during the hiring process. Lots of "around-the-bush" answers during interview questions. Expectations of staff are constantly changing on a whim and no clear-cut procedures in many areas and for many tasks. Training is minimal at best. High turnover. Many new staff members are being told to provide services without adequate (or any) training or proper guidance. Lots of disorganization in many areas.

review_title: Would give it 0 Stars if i could
pros: Working in the corporate office - You can have coffee in the am as long as you make a "donation" for it.
cons: If you enjoy getting yelled at, threatened with your job consistently and wake up every morning with a huge lump in your throat then working at cenikors corporate office is for you.  They rule with a culture of fear and intimidation and the CEO is not happy unless he is yelling at someone. They are all over the map with polices and procedures - no one can figure out how to implement anything.  turnover across the entire foundation is out of control but never addressed.  Pay is purposely low and the hours are long.  You will leave each day feeling like crap about yourself, management mainly the CEO refers to the clients as thugs and has no sympathy or regard for anyone but himself.

pros: Working for a company that not only changes lives but helps save lives. A great place to learn and to grow in the field. Great benefits and incentives. Senior staff have an open door policy. If you need to talk or advice the door is always open. It can be high stress but the rewards in return are worth it. If you care and have passion for the field of substance abuse you will succeed in this company. All staff from clinical to nursing to front line Behavioral Tech staff care greatly for their clients and work to better the lives of the client they serve.
cons: Can be high stress at times

job_title: Prevention Specialist in San Marcos, TX
pros:
I see that a lot of different locations have very bad reviews and this bothers me. What bothers me is not the person behind the review, but the "management styles"  that seem to exist within the company.  In an understanding that there are many bad apples out there that will try to sabotage a company, a majority of the negative reviews I saw, could have been prevented. These negative reviews indicate that the supervisor doesn't seem to understand that you are not supposed to "manage" your employees.  You are supposed to lead.  
 
In my job quest, I turned down many offers and have tried to endure the impossible in negative work environments.  However, when I stepped foot into this facility for my interview, I knew there was something different about it. 

Social services can be a very tough field to endure. In order to take care of people, we need to be taken care of as well. This location does a very GOOD job at doing this. Here, a supervisor is considered a leader, and the employees are considered a TEAM!  

A typical day of work: Often, my leader has gone from door to door, interacting with us and making sure that we are OKAY!  This is the most positive experience I have dealt with in working in social services and I hope that absolutely nothing gets in the way of me continuing employment here.

I have had plenty of time to TRAIN! Training is so important to me, as I've found that many jobs have thrown tasks at me that I have found difficult due to lack of training.  Each day, I feel more and more comfortable with the work I will be doing here in the future.  There is multiple opportunities to grow and develop.  The most enjoyable part of the job has been my coworkers and the population I am serving.  

Even better, the team is always looking out for me, and I feel the same way about them!  In other organizations, asking questions and receiving annoyed looks was usually already a downer for me, and indication that the work environment was going to be hostile.  Every day, someone at this place is always at my door, giving me some helpful information or resources.

Overall, organizations have to really watch out who they are hiring as leaders. Those leaders need to understand that times will be tough working in social services positions, but what will add to that stress is a lack of self-care, self-awareness, empathy, and allowing the negative energies of others to transfer in their daily conversations and actions in their organization.

I would love to say more, about how great the leadership is here, but I know I could go on and on about it... You'd be reading a book.

If you really want to know more, you'd apply to Cenikor in San Marcos, TX :)
cons: The office can get cold sometimes and there are no windows.

job_title: Vice President/Chief Financial Officer in Houston, TX
pros: Cenikor is the best company I have ever worked for. The environment is entrepreneurial, fast-paced, and exciting.  The organization is financially sound, strategically organized, and innovative. The leadership team works together so you feel like you are an important part of building something that is great.  There is enormous opportunity for growth and development, and everyone is there to help you succeed.
cons: None. No downsides working at Cenikor.
